_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
Elkhorn Valley Ethanol, LLC

Elkhorn Valley Ethanol, LLC (EVE) ethanol Plant is a newly constructed facility.  EVE plans to begin operations at the ethanol plant in September 2007. Many of the reports and information have only recently been developed, and much of the training has been ongoing.  Given that EVE is a new facility, there have been periodic reviews and revisions to reports and information maintained at the facility to date.  

Accidental Release Prevention and Response Policies:

EVE has a commitment to worker and public safety.  This commitment is demonstrated in the resources invested in accident prevention, such as training personnel as well as considering safety in the design, installation, operation, and maintenance of the facility.

EVE?s policy is to implement reasonable controls to prevent foreseeable releases of regulated substances.  However, if a release does occur, plant personnel will respond to contain the release as necessary. The two ethanol tanks, two final product tanks, and denaturant tank are all located in a large bermed Tank Farm containment area that is separated from the plant.  A release from one of these tanks would not be able to migrate off-site, and a fire could be quickly extinguished.  EVE has coordinated with the Norfolk Fire Department for emergency response procedures.

Description of the Stationary Source and Regulated Substances:

The EVE Ethanol Plant is located near Norfolk, Madison County, Nebraska.

The facility operates 24 hours per day, 7 days per week for the purpose of manufacturing fuel grade ethanol from corn.  The regulated substance under the RMP program is Anhydrous Ammonia and Denaturant (natural gasoline) which is considered a flammable mixture.  EVE Ethanol Plant has determined that the radius of impact from a worst-case release would be about 5.6 miles; due to the amount of ammonia stored on site.  The radius of impact for denaturant is about 0.7 miles.

Off-site

Consequence Analysis Results:

The worst case scenario at the facility is the release of all 102,420 pounds of ammonia creating a toxic cloud.  The worst-case scenario is based on the release of all ammonia stored on site.  The worst case vapor cloud endpoint is approximately 5.6 miles from the center of the plant.  Public receptors are located within this 5.6 mile radius.   The worst-case scenario at the facility is the release of 925,000 pounds of denaturant creating a vapor cloud explosion.  The worst-case scenario is based on a release from entire denaturant tank.  The worst case vapor cloud endpoint is approximately 0.7 miles from the center of the facility.  Public receptors are also located within the 0.7 mile radius.

Although EVE Ethanol Plant has numerous controls in place to prevent such a release and to manage potential consequences, no credit for administrative controls or passive mitigation measures were taken into account in evaluating this scenario.

Since the facility qualifies as a Program 3 due to the close proximity of public receptors, Program Safety Management has to be completed for this facility.

Since the facility also qualifies as a Program 3, Alternative Release Scenarios (ARS) were required.  The ARS is the release of 550,000 pounds of denaturant creating a vapor cloud explosion.  The ARS endpoint is approximately 0.6 miles from the center of the facility.  The ARS is the toxic release of 4,780 pounds per minute of ammonia.  The ARS endpoint is approximately 1.3 miles from the center of the facility.  There are public receptors within the 0.1 mile radius that would be affected by both alternative releases.

Five Year Accident History:

EVE Ethanol Plant has constructed a new ethanol facility and is subject to RMP upon delivery of substances onsite. There have been no accidents at this time.

Emergency Response Program Information:

The EVE Ethanol Plant has several safety programs in place at the facility that incorporate emergency respo

nse, including a Health and Safety Plan.  An FRP & SPCC Plan will be prepared and implemented in accordance with applicable regulatory standards and timeframes.

The facility also conducts employee training as part of facility activities.  EVE Ethanol Plant's corporate policy places the utmost importance on worker, public and environmental safety, which is reflected in facility plans and training activities.
